challengeName: UNI - Sales Portal iPad iOS Swift F2F Icon Swap - realworldswift
detailedRequirements:
Challenge Overview
 
The goal of this F2F challenge is to update several sets of icons used in our existing iPad application.
 
Overall Project Description
 
Our partner is developing a state-of-the-art tablet based sales and order processing tool. Their sales team will be managing client visits, tasks, calendars, notifications, and order processing all through this tool. The platform is the Apple iPad.
 
Icon Swaps
 
Main Right-hand side menu icons
 
These icons will be contained in the "Menu-icons" folder. Please see the “Manager Menu Icons.pdf” for:
 
  • icon order
  • placement
  • bg color
  • the options the manager user sees when he taps “manage login”
 
Please swap the existing icons in the application for the new icons in this folder.
 
Global Search icons
 
These icons are contained in the "Global-Search-icons" folder. Please see the "Global Search Screens.pdf" file for further illustration. This screen is accessed by tapping the Search item in the right hand menu.
 
  • The default Global Search menu should have its icons replaced with the icons in the "Global-Search-icons/Default" folder.
  • When a user taps on “sales tools” (last icon item) the menu will slide up to reveal a second layer of menu options, related to sales tools. These icons should be replaced with the icons in the "Global-Search-icons/Sales Tools Submenu" folder.
  • In the search results area (below these menus) some items have Email icons, please replace the icon used here with the icon from the Main Right-hand-side menu. Please size it appropriately and match the color to the existing icon.
 
Account icons
 
These icons are contained in the "Account-icons" folder. Please see the "Account Info Content - Approved copy.pdf" file for further illustration.
 
  • replace the current “phone” icon with the new “contact” (email) icon
  • replace the current “map” icon with the new “map” icon
  • replace the current “site” icon with the new “company website” icon
  • replace the current “In” icon with the new “linked” icon
  • replace the current “g+” icon with the new “google” icon
  • Results in areas like contacts, notes & attachments, activities and opportunities & quotes can be slid to the left to reveal the edit and delete options. Replace the existing icons for these with the new ones
 
Note: The tap / color change on these icons should NOT be the current grey. When tapped, there should be NO change to these icons (just launch related items). There is no “tapped on” state for these icons.
 
Calendar icons
 
These icons are contained in the "Calendar-icons" folder. The calendar are of the application will contain two sections, calendar and todo.
 
In the calendar:
 
  • The user will see BOTH meetings and to-dos
  • On left slide of a MEETING result header, the user will see options for: change time and delete.
  • On the left slide of a TO DO result header here, the user will see options for: done, snooze and delete.
  • Swap in the new icons for each of these areas
 
In the todo list:
 
  • The user will only see to-dos (which are not date-related)
  • On left slide of a TO DO result header here, the user will see options for: done and delete (NO SNOOZE OPTION).
  • Swap in the new icons for each of these areas
 
Additional - Seller Meeting Detail
 
  • we only see meetings in the calendar (not in the to do list)
  • when a user taps a result header, it will slide down / open to reveal more details and related icon options.
  • Icon options here are:
    • Account icon (currently a “person” head / swap to the new “folder” account icon)
    • Contact icon (currently a “phone” / swap to the new “email” icon)
    • Map icon (swap in the new map icon - same design concept but slightly different)

 
Application-wide Icon Swaps
 
We use the search (magnifying glass), calendar and email icons all over the application. Since the app has been built over several challenges / designs using multiple members, we have some inconstancies in icons. Please make sure that all of these instances are using the icons we use in the menu, rather than unique icons, for consistency!
 
Important: the sizing on these unique instances of  search (magnifying glass), calendar and email icons is different (smaller, different colors) that the menu version. Please match the existing color and size when swapping in the new version of the icon.
 
  • Global Search Results > Results “calendar” button - Please swap email icon used in the buttons here match the menu icon provided (need to edit size and color for this instance)
  • Presentations Screens > Results “email” button - Please swap email icon used in the buttons here match the menu icon provided (need to edit size and color for this instance)
  • Coach to Win Screens > Materials > Results “email” button - Please swap email icon used in the buttons here match the menu icon provided (need to edit size and color for this instance)
  • Coach to Win Screens > Ride along evaluation form - Please swap calendar icon used in the buttons here match the menu icon provided (need to edit size and color for this instance)
  • Coach to Win Screens > Ride along evaluation > Team Member new to do form - Please swap calendar icon used in the buttons here match the menu icon provided (need to edit size and color for this instance)
  • Create New Account form - Please swap calendar icon used here match the menu icon provided (need to edit size and color for this instance)
  • Account > Activites (edit & create new) forms - Please swap calendar icon used here match the menu icon provided (need to edit size and color for this instance)
  • Account > Opportunities (edit & create new) forms - Please swap calendar icon used here match the menu icon provided (need to edit size and color for this instance)
  • Account > Next Steps  >What’s next new (meeting & to do) forms - Please swap calendar icon used here match the menu icon provided (need to edit size and color for this instance)
 
Setup
 
Source code for this project will be included in the forums.
 
This contest will not require you to do any direct work with the Salesforce Mobile SDK, but it is a required element of the overall application. As such you will need to be able to login to Salesforce the first time you run the application in order to access the other components of the application. The credentials are as follows:
 
Username: uni1@topcoder.com
Password: community123
 
** Note: You need to set the login location to "Sandbox" in the iPad (or simulator settings). This is under regular IOS settings (in the Compass app section)
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Required Deliverables:
 
  • Cocoa Touch framework Xcode 6.1.1 project with well commented code
  • Code must compile against iOS SDK 8.1 with a deployment target of iOS 7.0
  • Upload all source projects as a zip
  • Documentation of all project / source files changed in the solution
